signalGreen

Class Utils

  • java.lang.Object
    • signalGreen.Utils

  • public class Utils
extends java.lang.Object
    Most utility functions are used for geographic calculations, such as distance between coordinates or azimuth of a road segment.
    Author:
    Signal Green team

        Returns:

        public static Junction getPopularJunction(java.util.List<Junction> junctions)

      • getAngle

        public static double getAngle(com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.Coordinate c1,
              com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.Coordinate c2,
              repast.simphony.space.gis.Geography g)
        Returns the angle in radians given two coordinates. Radians to degrees conversion = angle * 2 * PI
        Parameters:
        c1 - first coord
        c2 - second coord
        g - geography
        Returns:
        angle in radians

      • getAzimuth

        public static double getAzimuth(com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.Coordinate c1,
                com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.Coordinate c2,
                repast.simphony.space.gis.Geography g)
        Given two coordinates it returns the azimuth. Azimuth = angle in range of (+-) 180 degrees
        Parameters:
        c1 - coordinate
        c2 - coordinate
        g - geography
        Returns:
        azimuth in double precision

      • createCoordsFromCoordAndAngle

        public static com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.Coordinate[] createCoordsFromCoordAndAngle(com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.Coordinate c,
                                                                     double azimuth,
                                                                     double distance,
                                                                     repast.simphony.space.gis.Geography g)
        Returns two coordinates that are perpendicular (+-90 degrees) to a given angle from a starting point on Earth, at a given distance from c. Used for creating Lanes on the left and right of a Road.
        Parameters:
        c - the coordinate
        azimuth -
        distance -
        g - the geography
        Returns:
        array of coordinates

      • getAngleForIcons

        public static double getAngleForIcons(com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.Coordinate c1,
                      com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.Coordinate c2,
                      repast.simphony.space.gis.Geography g)
        Returns a correct angle for displaying graphics correctly on the GIS projection. Angle of orientation of graphics must be computed from grid north as opposed to true north, which may not point to the top of the display.
        Parameters:
        c1 -
        c2 -
        geography -
        Returns:
        azimuth
